title: How to Make Eggplant Fritters

steps.headline: Slice the eggplant into 3 mm (1/8 of an inch, or 1/3 of a cm) thick slices.
steps.description: You can slice in rounds or lengths; the preference is yours but round slices tend to be easier to handle.

steps.headline: Soak in salted water for 10 minutes.
steps.description: Drain after 10 minutes and leave to one side for later use.

steps.headline: Beat the egg with a quarter teaspoon of fine salt.
steps.description: Add the pepper powder to beaten egg and whisk gently. Dip the eggplant slices into the egg batter.

steps.headline: Coat the dipped slices with the breadcrumbs.
steps.description: Place the breadcrumbs into a wide bowl or flat plate and lay the slices direct into the breadcrumbs, and then turn over to coat the other side. Lay on a tray or plate while waiting for frying. Keep this tray or plate close to the stove top for ease of use.

steps.headline: Fry the coated eggplant slices in oil until golden brown in color.
Drain the oil off each fritter on wax paper, kitchen towel, or cardboard.
Serve.
steps.description: Eggplant fritters can be eaten and served in many different and creative ways. They can be served as a meal of their own, accompanied by salad and vegetables, or they can be served as a side dish. They make great snacks. Pickles, flavored mayonnaise, and sauces go well with eggplant fritters. Serve with vegetables as a delicious vegetarian meal when vegetarians turn up without warning.
